results.title: Singapore dollars
results.creator_credit: Edward Dunstan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Edward Dunstan served in the Australian Navy for 20 years, spending a significant part of that time in Singapore. While he enjoyed his time there, Dunstan also has some bad memories, not least of all was how he was received by his fellow Australians on his return. However, these experiences have encouraged him to help others through his work at the RSL.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edward Dunstan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: A Look from their side
results.creator_credit: Robert Cole, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Reflecting on his service in Borneo during World War II, Robert Cole was impressed by the kindness and warmth of the local people, despite being forced to live through war and poverty. In doing so, they taught Cole about gratitude.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Cole, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: An Interview with James Ross Irvine
results.brief_description: James Ross Irvine and his brother were both involved in significant battles in Papua New Guinea in World War II. With a stoic sensibility and grim humour, Irvine relates the story of the last time he saw his brother before he was killed in battle.
results.description: James Ross Irvine and his brother were both involved in significant battles in Papua New Guinea in World War II. With a stoic sensibility and grim humour, Irvine relates the story of the last time he saw his brother before he was killed in battle.

results.title: An Interview with Colin Bannister
results.brief_description: In 1950, Colin Bannister sailed from Syndey to Singapore to defend the Malayan Government against an uprising in what was called ‘The Malayan Emergency’. Bannister’s time in Malaya has taught him about power and the important things in life.
results.description: In 1950, Colin Bannister sailed from Syndey to Singapore to defend the Malayan Government against an uprising in what was called ‘The Malayan Emergency’. Bannister’s time in Malaya has taught him about power and the important things in life.

results.title: Hollywood Costume: What is Costume Design? with Prof. D. Nadoolman Landis
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI

video_links.name: Hollywood Costume: What is Costume Design? with Prof. D. Nadoolman Landis

results.brief_description:
In a special event held at ACMI as part of the ‘Hollywood Costume’ exhibition, curator Professor Deborah Nadoolman Landis introduced the art of costume design and discussed its role in cinematic storytelling.
Landis, an Oscar®-nominated Hollywood costume designer (‘Raiders of the Lost Ark’, ‘The Blues Brothers’, Michael Jackson’s ‘Thriller’) is also the author of ‘Hollywood Costume’ (2012), the prize-winning exhibition catalogue, and ‘Hollywood Sketchbook: A Century of Costume Illustration’ (2012) among many other volumes.
Landis received her Ph.D. from the Royal College of Art in London and is the Founding Director of the David C. Copley Center for Costume Design at the UCLA School of Theater, Film and Television.
results.title_for_label: Hollywood Costume: What is Costume Design? with Prof. D. Nadoolman Landis
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI

results.title: Lella Smith interview with Emma McRae

video_links.name: Lella Smith interview with Emma McRae

results.brief_description: Lella Smith is the Creative Director of the Walt Disney Animation and Research Library and curator of the ‘Dreams Come True: The Art of Disney’s Classic Fairytales’ exhibition. In this interview, Emma McRae, ACMI Exhibitions Curator, speaks to Lella about how the exhibition came about and the enormous task of selecting the films and items for exhibition from Disney’s vast archives.
results.description: Lella Smith is the Creative Director of the Walt Disney Animation and Research Library and curator of the ‘Dreams Come True: The Art of Disney’s Classic Fairytales’ exhibition. In this interview, Emma McRae, ACMI Exhibitions Curator, speaks to Lella about how the exhibition came about and the enormous task of selecting the films and items for exhibition from Disney’s vast archives.

results.title: The legacy of Len Lye
results.brief_description:
Tyler Cann talks about the works on display in the Len Lye exhibition at ACMI and the legacy of an extraordinary artist. Tyler Cann is the Curator of the Len Lye Collection at the Govett-Brewster Art Gallery, New Zealand.
Interview recorded in July 2009.
results.description:

results.title: An Interview with Jan McCarthy
results.brief_description: Jan McCarthy traces her career path of nursing, how it took her overseas and her time in the army, posted in Vietnam and Singapore. In Singapore, McCarthy became a Major and was later promoted to Colonel. She has no regrets about serving in the army and sees it as one big family.
results.description: Jan McCarthy traces her career path of nursing, how it took her overseas and her time in the army, posted in Vietnam and Singapore. In Singapore, McCarthy became a Major and was later promoted to Colonel. She has no regrets about serving in the army and sees it as one big family.

results.title: TV50 Celebrity Interviews
results.creator_credit: ACMI Content Development, Astrid Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Interviews with thirteen celebrities from Australian television. Asked the same questions, their responses are recorded vox pop style. Questions asked concern the celebrities’ experiences of television both as a viewer and as a personality and performer as well as their thoughts on reality television and the state of Australian television in general. Interviews were conducted at ACMI for the TV50 exhibition in 2006.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Content Development, Astrid Scott and ACMI

Interviews were conducted at ACMI for the TV50 exhibition in 2006.

results.title: An Interview with Laurie Price
results.creator_credit: Laurie Price, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Laurie Price is one of the remaining third of those Australians who served in Korea. He provides sharp detail of the work he performed there on the airfields, the distractions and tensions, even between allies. While the war is long over, it continues to affect Price even today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurie Price, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
